Methods

IsFinite(MarginPadding)

Returns whether the components of a MarginPadding are not infinite or NaN.

For further information, see IsFinite(float).

public static bool IsFinite(MarginPadding toCheck)

Parameters

toCheck MarginPadding

The MarginPadding to check.

Returns

bool

False if either component of toCheck are Infinity or NaN, true otherwise.

IsFinite(Vector2)

Returns whether the two coordinates of a osuTK.Vector2 are not infinite or NaN.

For further information, see IsFinite(float).

public static bool IsFinite(Vector2 toCheck)

Parameters

toCheck Vector2

The osuTK.Vector2 to check.

Returns

bool

False if X or Y are Infinity or NaN, true otherwise.

IsSupportedBindableNumberType<T>()

Whether the specified type T is a number type supported by BindableNumber<T>.

public static bool IsSupportedBindableNumberType<T>()

Returns

bool

true if the type is supported; false otherwise.

Type Parameters

T

The type to check for.

Remarks

Directly comparing typeof(T) to type literal is recognized pattern of JIT and very fast. Just a pointer comparison for reference types, or constant for value types. The check will become NOP in usages after optimization.

TryParseUri(string, out Uri?)

Attempts to parse uriString as an absolute or relative Uri in a platform-agnostic manner.

public static bool TryParseUri(string uriString, out Uri? result)

Parameters

uriString string

The string representation of the URI to parse.

result Uri

The resultant parsed URI, if parsing succeeded.

Returns

bool

true if parsing succeeded; false otherwise.

Remarks

This method is a workaround for inconsistencies across .NET and mono runtimes; on mono runtimes paths starting with / are considered absolute as per POSIX, and on .NET such paths are considered to be relative. This method uses the .NET behaviour. For more info, see Mono documentation.
